segments.text: I want to tell you I've put in my notice .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I've been thinking about this for several months , well before the Spring Festival holidays .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: and the holidays provided you a chance to think over all this and make a decision ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: yeah , after receiving my yearly bouns , I want to search out better opportunities in the spring job market . I've been working in the company for nearly a year and a half and I still haven't received
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: absolutely . With your expertise and experience , you're clearly working below your pay grade .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that's exactly why I decided to quit the job and find a new one .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: this way , you'll earn more at the new work place .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that's right . I am not the only one who has done this . Job hopping is quite common in the IT industry .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that is to say , most IT professionals can get a pay rise more easily by changing a job than waiting for a rise . I'm wondering why IT companies are always willing to pay more to new employees instead
segments.speaker: S2
